alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Coal; Hughes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 12 at 12:43AM CDT until May 12 at 1:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT FOR COAL...CENTRAL ATOKA AND SOUTH CENTRAL HUGHES COUNTIES... At 1242 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles northeast of Hartshorne to 3 miles west of Stringtown, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Atoka, Coalgate, Stringtown, Lehigh, Tupelo, Bromide, Centrahoma, Clarita, Olney, Wardville, Daisy, Phillips, Atoka Reservoir, Chockie, northern McGee Creek Lake, and Redden. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
